etymology.description: semantic: 頁(頁) (yè, "page/head") + phonetic: 彥(彥) (yàn) = face related to the head -> face
etymology.interpretation: 頁(頁) (yè, "page/head") indicates the character is related to the head, while 彥(彥) (yàn) provides the phonetic component. Together, they combine to signify 'face,' a prominent part of the head.
etymology.simplification: Simplified to 颜(顏) by replacing 頁(頁) (yè, "page/head") with a simpler version without the 'head' radical.

examples.chinese: 他的顏流露出淡淡的忧伤(他的顏流露出淡淡的憂傷)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de yán liúlù chū dàndàn de yōushāng.
examples.english: His face shows a hint of sorrow.

examples.chinese: 她看了看镜子(她看了看鏡子)，发现自己的顏上挂着笑容(發現自己的顏上掛著笑容)。
examples.pinyin: Tā kànle kàn jìngzi, fāxiàn zìjǐ de yán shàng guàzhe xiàoróng.
examples.english: She looked in the mirror and found a smile on her face.
